item.title: Salt Lake City Guided Bus Tour
item.description: Go sightseeing in Salt Lake City with ease on this bus tour. You’ll see some of Utah's top urban attractions like the Mormon Trail, Temple Square, the State Capitol Building, Old Fort Douglas and sites from the 2002 Winter Olympic Games. Hear stories of the pioneers, the Mormon religion, and historical anecdotes. A highlight of the tour is witnessing the 12,000 pipes of the famous Salt Lake Tabernacle organ.

image.alt: Salt Lake City Guided Bus Tour

item.title: Tabernacle Choir Performance + Salt Lake City Bus Tour
item.description: Enjoy a performance from the world-renowned Tabernacle Choir plus a sightseeing tour of Salt Lake City, Utah on this tour. Start with a bus tour around Utah’s high-elevation capital. See many of the city’s popular sites, like the Utah State Capitol building, This is the Place Heritage Park, and the 10-acre Temple Square complex. Then take in a performance by the Grammy- and Emmy award-winning, 360-member, all-volunteer Tabernacle Choir.

image.alt: Tabernacle Choir Performance + Salt Lake City Bus Tour

item.title: Trolley Adventure: A Show-Tour of Salt Lake City
item.description: Explore Salt Lake City on this 1.5-hour trolley tour. Traveling on a replica streetcar, you'll see the city's historical districts and make several photo stops at landmarks and attractions. The uniformed trolley conductor acts as your guide. Select a morning or afternoon tour when booking.

image.alt: Trolley Adventure: A Show-Tour of Salt Lake City

item.title: Great Salt Lake Wildlife and Sunset Experience
item.description: Utah's wilderness is easily accessible from downtown Salt Lake when you visit Antelope Island in the Great Salt Lake. The island contains beautiful scenery, sprawling lakeside vistas, and plenty of wildlife. We'll look out for the herd of 600 American Bison roaming the island, as well as coyote, bobcat, antelope, porcupine, big-horn sheep, mule deer, and seasonal migratory birds. Afterwards, hike to Buffalo Point via a moderate and well traveled .9 mile trail to catch the sunset.

image.alt: Great Salt Lake Wildlife and Sunset Experience

item.title: 2 Hour Salt Lake Boat Tour with Swimming on the Lake
item.description: Venture out onto Utah's Great Salt Lake for a swim in the western hemisphere's largest saltwater lake. Join a small group and board a pontoon for your journey across the massive lake. Stop at two locations for swims so you can feel how buoyant you are in the salty waters and take in the views of the surroundings while you sail.

image.alt: 2 Hour Salt Lake Boat Tour with Swimming on the Lake

item.title: Great Salt Lake and Antelope Island Day Tour
item.description: Immerse yourself in the Great Salt Lake’s unique and dramatic scenery—and explore its largest island, as well as its best nature-viewing areas—on this small-group, half-day hiking tour. With round-trip transit from select hotels, getting there is easy. You’ll explore Antelope Island State Park on a 1-mile (1.6-kilometer) hike, will look out for wildlife (from bison and bighorn sheep to local birds) at Fielding Garr Ranch, and more.

image.alt: Great Salt Lake and Antelope Island Day Tour

item.title: Salt Lake City Haunted Old Town Tour
item.description: Discover the darker side of Salt Lake City on a 1.5-hour tour that explores the mysteries, hauntings, and other paranormal activity in Utah’s capital city. Hear some of the city’s most terrifying legends and visit the oldest buildings in Salt Lake where ghosts sightings are frequent. Attempt your own paranormal investigation by trying out ghost hunting equipment on this tour.

image.alt: Salt Lake City Haunted Old Town Tour

item.title: Salt Lake Ghosts and Hauntings Tour By US Ghost Adventures
item.description:
Dive into Salt Lake City’s eerie past with our thrilling walking ghost tour, where history and the supernatural intertwine!
Guided by a local expert and master storyteller, you’ll explore a mile of haunted ground, visiting iconic sites brimming with ghostly encounters. Wander through the historic district and feel the chill of spectral sightings at places like the Hotel Plandome and the Exchange Place Historic District, where echoes of the past resonate with every step.
Uncover unsettling secrets beneath the city's serene surface as you visit the Frank E. Moss Federal Courthouse, Old Post Office, and the infamous “Whiskey Street.” While we can’t enter private buildings, the thrill of standing on haunted ground will send shivers down your spine.
Each stop offers a chance to connect with restless spirits, turning this tour into a spine-tingling adventure you’ll remember long after it ends!

image.alt: Salt Lake Ghosts and Hauntings Tour By US Ghost Adventures

item.title: Great Salt Lake Guided Bus Tour from Salt Lake City
item.description: You can’t travel to Utah without visiting the Great Salt Lake. Don’t miss the chance to explore the shores one of Utah’s most fascinating natural attractions. On this tour, you’ll experience the unique wonders of this inland sea—and have the chance to float on the lake as well. Packed with insider information and local lore, the bus tour covers a distance of 50 miles (80km) and is lead by an engaging, local guide.

image.alt: Great Salt Lake Guided Bus Tour from Salt Lake City

item.title: Salt Lake City Big City Loop Bike Tour
item.description: Embark on an exploratory tour of Salt Lake City by bicycle, departing from Liberty Park. Your locally based guide offers a comprehensive look at the capital city, with multiple stops at points of interest in the greater downtown area. See historical and contemporary monuments and learn about the city’s Mormon pioneers. Bikes and helmets are provided.

image.alt: Salt Lake City Big City Loop Bike Tour

item.title: Private Half-Day tour to Bonneville Salt Flats
item.description:
*Start times and Pickup locations are decided by traveler*
**Salt Flats frequently covered in water between November & April.**
No one will probably ever beat the land speed record at the Bonneville Salt Flats (763 mph), but that doesn't mean we cannot still go fast! This tour will take you and your party onto the famous track where so many land speed records have been set and broken. While we won't even get close to the records speed, for those who desire it, we give them their own racing experience (often hitting speeds of 120...yes it's perfectly safe).
Whether you enjoy fast speeds or not, the Salt Flats west of Salt Lake City are an incredible destination that everyone must see if given the chance! Our guides will help you and your part create fun and meaningful photos for you to remember your trip by (see attached photos).
We hope you enjoy our time with us!

image.alt: Private Half-Day tour to Bonneville Salt Flats

item.title: Salt Lake City Walking Tour
item.description: Experience the unique and culturally diverse downtown of Salt Lake City, UT. From the “Mormon” Pioneers who settled the area to the influence of modern culture, the arts, 2002 Olympics, and the influx of people from all over the world, Salt Lake City has many sights and stories to experience firsthand. Join us for a 2.5-3-hour walking tour of the downtown area. As you walk the 3-mile loop through the downtown area you will hear the stories about the founders of this city and those whose influence are continuing to shape this metropolitan area today. Along with the unique stories you will experience the diverse and unique architecture found throughout the downtown area. This all combines to create the unique vibe that exists in Salt Lake City. Join us today. Your Adventure Awaits!

image.alt: Salt Lake City Walking Tour

item.title: Bonneville Salt Flats Adventure
item.description: Unveil the surreal beauty of the Bonneville Salt Flats on this half-day adventure! This excursion explores this natural phenomenon unlike any other. Walk across the seemingly endless salt crust, capturing panoramic photos and experiencing the awe-inspiring flatness that makes the Bonneville Salt Flats so legendary. Learn about the land speed racing that takes place here, where legendary feats of speed were achieved. We offer this tour in the morning and afternoon to best suit your schedule. Each tour last six hours (including the drive from and back to Salt Lake City) and provides ample time to explore the Salt Flats, with stops at Great Salt Lake State Park and the Tree of Life sculpture – a captivating landmark standing amidst the vast desert landscape.

image.alt: Bonneville Salt Flats Adventure

item.title: 2-Day Private Trip to Moab from Salt Lake City for 4 People
item.description: This is a fun-filled trip to Moab, Utah, the adventure capital of the state. All multi-day tours from Salt Lake City to Moab are private trips, so all tours are customizable to your interests, needs, and preferences. This tour is priced for 4 people in a hotel room with two queen beds. Each additional room is $250. Please contact us for different group sizes, special requests, or additional rooms.

image.alt: 2-Day Private Trip to Moab from Salt Lake City for 4 People

item.title: Ultimate Utah Bundle Self-Guided Driving Audio Tour
item.description: Utah is a state filled with natural beauty and several landmarks. Purchase this self-driving audio tour that features all of the state’s top sights including Zion National Park, Monument Valley, Bryce Canyon, Arches, Canyonlands ,and Grand Staircase - Escalante, Whether you want to explore a certain section of the state or do a grand tour, this audio tour has something for everyone.

image.alt: Ultimate Utah Bundle Self-Guided Driving Audio Tour

item.title: Great Salt Lake Flying Tour
item.description: On this unique, adventurous experience you will get a a birds eye view of The Great Salt Lake that puts into perspective the scale and beauty of this top Utah attraction. What would take a full day to see by car, we will squeeze into an action packed 40 minute flight. The GSL is an iconic landmark and you will see views that have been constantly evolving since it’s creation during the Bonneville flood over 14,500 years ago! One of the benefits of visiting the lake by air is we have no negative ecological impact. You will see many of the animals that call the Great Salt Lake home such as elk, antelope, buffalo, deer, coyote, and even eagles. After a quick safety briefing we will get in the plane, buckle up, and begin our adventure. Half of the flight will be up high with expansive views, and the other half will be "low and slow" where you will feel like we are in a flying car.

image.alt: Great Salt Lake Flying Tour

item.title: The Bonneville Salt Flats Tour
item.description:
The Bonneville Salt Flats are a unique geological wonder seen in very few places around the world. We will travel there (1.5 hour drive one-way from Salt Lake City) in a 9 person Van. We'll share some amazing geological facts about the lake, it's history and current state. The expansive wilderness and drive to the Salt Flats is simply incredible.
While the drive is quite far to the Salt Flats from Salt Lake City, we stop a couple times to help break it up. We drive by the southern edge of the Great Salt Lake and stop at the Visitors Center. We stop at the Tree of Life Sculpture and at 2 different points at the Flats themselves
*The Salt Flats dry in the summer and typically wet in the winter. When wet, it's often calm, sending mirror like reflections of the mountains in the background.
If it's wet we'll bring our gum boots and walk out into the flats. The photo opportunities and Views are endless!
Walk: Easy + Flat, 1 mile out and back.

image.alt: The Bonneville Salt Flats Tour

item.title: Pick Your Park: Private Day Tour From Salt Lake City
item.description: Plan a completely custom itinerary—and enjoy a seamless way to explore Utah’s wealth of scenery—on this private, full-day tour from Salt Lake City. Meet your guide at your preferred address, and hop aboard an SUV complete with snacks and comforts. The destination is up to you: choose between Arches, Canyonlands, or Capitol Reef National Parks, Bryce Canyon National Park or Goblin Valley State Park. A freshly cooked lunch is also included.

image.alt: Pick Your Park: Private Day Tour From Salt Lake City

item.title: Salt Lake City Driving Tour
item.description: Want to experience Salt Lake City but don’t have a lot of time? This is a great tour to see some of what is waiting for you in Salt Lake City! Learn about the history of the valley, the unique and eclectic people that call this area home and experience the architecture and outdoor space found in Utah’s Capital City. From is storied history of the Mormon Pioneers to a mining boomtown with its red light districts, Salt Lake City has always had a multi-cultural and storied history that will come alive during this 3 hour excursion. Join us. Your Adventure Awaits!

image.alt: Salt Lake City Driving Tour

item.title: 4-Day Small Group Tour: Yellowstone and Tetons Camping from Salt Lake City
item.description: Discover all that Yellowstone National Park and the Grand Tetons have to offer on a 4-day small-group camping tour. This trekking excursion is perfect for solo travelers and couples who want to meet fellow adventurers. All camping materials and meals are conveniently provided. With a guide on hand providing commentary every step of the way, there’s no need to worry over wrong turns or depend on outdated travel materials.

image.alt: 4-Day Small Group Tour: Yellowstone and Tetons Camping from Salt Lake City

item.title: Private Half-Day Drive Through the Wasatch Mountain Range
item.description:
*Start times are flexible*
Travel through one of the most scenic mountain drives in the entire country.
We will travel from Salt Lake through Parley's Canyon into the backside of the Wasatch mountain range (known as the Wasatch Back), passing historic Park City. From there we turn south and view beautiful Jordanelle Reservoir, before eventually reaching the mountain town of Heber.
From Heber we turn West and view the incredible Deer Creek Reservoir in the shadow of Mount Timpanogos. We soon descend into Provo canyon, following a meandering river, beneath tall mountains and cliffs. Eventually we will see Bridal Veil falls, where travels (if they choose) can take the short walk to see up close.
Our return to Salt Lake starts with a drive through one of the areas most beautiful drives; The Alpine loop! Travel past Sundance Ski Resort (Founded by Robert Redford) through switch backs, up and over a mountain and back down the other side! Watch for wild mountain Goats along the way!

image.alt: Private Half-Day Drive Through the Wasatch Mountain Range

item.title: Local Food Walking Tours in Salt Lake City
item.description: Learn the history of Salt Lake City and try foods from three different local restaurants in this small group walking tour. Meet up with your group at an easy to find location, and then start walking. Feel free to ask your guide questions as you walk by the attractions in Salt Lake City, and learn about other ways to spend your next trip, too.

image.alt: Local Food Walking Tours in Salt Lake City

item.title: Salt Lake City Sunset Bike and Brothel Tour
item.description: Explore Salt Lake City at sunset and learn about the prostitution history in this capital city of Utah on a guided, 3.5-hour bike and brothel tour. Get a comprehensive look at one of the fastest growing cities in the world, peddling from one point of interest to another, including the old red light districts.

image.alt: Salt Lake City Sunset Bike and Brothel Tour

item.title: Salt Lake City Bike and Brew Tour
item.description: This Salt Lake City bike tour combines sightseeing and sampling microbreweries for a tasty adventure on two wheels. Visit downtown area attractions and enjoy one sample each of three microbreweries with the option to purchase additional food and drinks, if you wish. Your tour includes a bike, a helmet, bottled water, and beer tastings. Since this is a small-group tour, you’ll have plenty of time to ask questions, too.

image.alt: Salt Lake City Bike and Brew Tour
